meanings.definition: In a manner related to the study of fluids in motion.
meanings.sent1: The boat moved hydrodynamically through the water.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer glided hydrodynamically through the pool.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duck hydrodynamically raced against the toy boat.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the leaves hydrodynamically through the air.
meanings.sent5: The paper airplane soared hydrodynamically across the room.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the dynamics of fluids.
meanings.sent1: The hydrodynamically designed boat cut through the waves effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The hydrodynamically shaped submarine moved silently underwater.
meanings.sent3: The hydrodynamically painted car looked sleek and fast.
meanings.sent4: The hydrodynamically efficient turbine generated clean energy.
meanings.sent5: The hydrodynamically optimized swim cap reduced drag in the water.

meanings.definition: Describing the behavior of fluids in motion.
meanings.sent1: The hydrodynamically flowing river carved a path through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The hydrodynamically swirling clouds indicated an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The hydrodynamically dancing flames mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent4: The hydrodynamically shifting sand dunes created a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The hydrodynamically moving jellyfish gracefully glided through the ocean.
